Thanks Pete. Given the amount of time it takes to do this kind of  
work in=
 relation to how much you get paid makes translation a rather  
thankless t=
ask. Getting some strokes every now and then makes it all  
worth while. So=
 thanks for this. Next up is Higo Hirata Hikozo with  
the same kind of ver=
y in depth analysis. There is more Mito Kinko on  
the way as well.

Gordon=


On Oct 16, 2006, at 1:41 AM, klepet33319 wrote:

> I received the NBTHK A=
B translations of 'Elementary Course in Sword
> Furniture and Fittings (128=
)' on Mito Kinko by Fukushi Shigeo this
> morning and I can see where you w=
ere coming from in your comments on
> the translation. Work well done and m=
uch appreciated. I have to laugh
> a bit at the title 'Elementary' as it's =
very in depth and it really
> puts into perspective how much there is to le=
arn in this field. Not
> being able to read Japanese of course puts so much=
 out of reach for so
> many of us that work such as yours is most highly va=
lued. It also puts
> into perspective just how much scholarship there is in=
 what men like
> Fukushi accomplish. I will be looking forward to your futu=
re  
> endeavors.
> Pete Klein
> PS: To all -- if you are not a member of t=
he NBTHK AB it is well worth
> it, IMHO.
